title: Revelation: Throne and Lamb
objective: See God's throne, the worthy Lamb, and the unfolding judgments that reveal divine justice.

required_passages.text: Holy, holy, holy... Worthy are you... Worthy is the Lamb who was slain... the seals were opened... the prayers of the saints rose before God.

segments.audio_script: John is taken into heaven's throne room where worship frames all end-time events.

Listen to Revelation 4-8:13. John sees God's throne and ceaseless worship. A sealed scroll appears, and only the slain yet living Lamb is worthy to open it. As seals are opened, judgments unfold, while God's people are marked and a vast multitude from every nation worships the Lamb. Trumpet judgments begin, showing partial but serious warnings on the earth.
Apocalyptic imagery reveals spiritual realities behind earthly turmoil and suffering.
History is not chaotic; it is governed from the throne through the Lamb. Judgment and mercy advance together, and the prayers of saints are integral to God's purposes.
Key themes include divine sovereignty, worship, the Lamb's worthiness, judgment, protection of God's people, and global redemption.
Reflect on this: Does your view of crisis begin with fear, or with the throne and the Lamb?
The Lamb reigns as judgments unfold. Next, Revelation intensifies conflict and unveils God's faithful witnesses.
